data.name: Chicken and Broccoli Rice Skillet
ingredients: 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts (about 400g), cut into bite-sized pieces
steps: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chicken pieces, season with salt, pepper, paprika, and thyme. Cook until chicken is golden and cooked through, about 6-8 minutes. Remove chicken and set aside.
Add remaining olive oil and saut√© onions until translucent, about 3 minutes. Add garlic and cook for 1 more minute.
Add uncooked rice to the skillet, stir and toast for 2 minutes.
Pour in chicken broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 10 minutes.
Add broccoli florets to the skillet, stir gently, cover again, and cook for another 10-12 minutes until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed.
Return cooked chicken to the skillet and gently mix with rice and broccoli. Let everything warm together for 2-3 minutes.
Taste and adjust seasoning with extra salt or pepper if needed. Serve hot.
tips: For creamier texture, add 1/2 cup grated cheese right before serving.
You can substitute brown rice but increase the broth and cooking time accordingly.
Add bell peppers or carrots for extra color and nutrition.
